results.adx_keywords: Christmas;United States Politics and Government;Immigration and Emigration;Cold and Cold Spells;Illegal Immigration;Buses;Abbott, Gregory W (1957- );Biden, Joseph R Jr;Harris, Kamala D;Washington (DC);Texas
results.title: Buses of Migrants Arrive at Kamala Harris’s Home on Christmas Eve
results.abstract: About 130 migrants from Texas were bused to the vice president’s home on one of the coldest Christmas Eves on record in the nation’s capital.

media.caption: Volunteers had anticipated three buses with about 130 immigrants to arrive in New York on Christmas Day, but the buses were rerouted to the vice president’s residence.

results.adx_keywords: Documentary Films and Programs;Christmas;Royal Families;Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge;Charles III, King of the United Kingdom;Harry, Duke of Sussex;Great Britain;London (England)
results.title: Charles Charts a Path as a King for All Holiday Seasons
results.abstract: Adding a Hanukkah party and Diwali treats to the traditional Christmas address, King Charles III is publicly embracing a more inclusive monarchy in his first months.
per_facet: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

media.caption: King Charles III, front right, with other members of the royal family on Sunday before the Christmas Day service at Sandringham Church in Sandringham, England.

results.adx_keywords: Snow and Snowstorms;Korean Food (Cuisine);Christmas;Choi, Yoseb;New York City;South Korea;Niagara Falls (NY)
results.title: They Traveled From South Korea. They Got Stranded Near Buffalo.
results.abstract: A South Korean tour group’s van became stuck in the snow outside a house in Williamsville, N.Y. They spent the weekend with the homeowners — who luckily had a well-stocked kitchen.

media.caption: Alexander Campagna, a dentist, and his wife, Andrea, a nurse practitioner, hosted 10 stranded South Korean visitors who were in a tour group headed to Niagara Falls.

results.title: Conservatives in Western Canada Pass Law Rejecting Federal Sovereignty
results.abstract: A new law in the province of Alberta radically circumscribes federal authority, advancing the agenda of the province’s far-right secessionist movement.

media.caption: Near Coutts, Alberta, in August. The province has long held grievances toward the federal government.
media.copyright: Amber Bracken for The New York Times

results.title: Covid Is Spreading Rapidly in China, New Signs Suggest
results.abstract: Even as official figures from the central government remain low, regional numbers point to explosive outbreaks and overstretched health care systems.

media.caption: Empty shelves at a pharmacy in Beijing on Tuesday. There are reported shortages of fever-reducing medications.
media.copyright: Gilles Sabrié for The New York Times

results.title: G.O.P. Gains Strength on N.Y. City Council, as a Democrat Breaks Ranks
results.abstract: Progressive Democrats and conservative Republicans are clashing on what may be the most ideologically diverse City Council ever.

media.copyright: Lev Radin/Sipa USA, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Engel, Robert W;Hutchinson, Cassidy;Ornato, Anthony M;Passantino, Stefan C;Trump, Donald J;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack;Secret Service
results.title: Jan. 6 Report Leaves Questions About What Happened in Trump’s S.U.V.
results.abstract: Witnesses had less detailed recollections than the account provided by Cassidy Hutchinson of a furious president reaching for the steering wheel when told he could not go to the Capitol.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: President Donald J. Trump exiting the presidential S.U.V., with Bobby Engel, a Secret Service agent, at right. A former White House aide recalled hearing about Mr. Trump lunging at Mr. Engel in the vehicle on Jan. 6, 2021, but others have given less detailed accounts.

results.adx_keywords: Transgender and Transsexuals;Discrimination;Law and Legislation;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;Content Type: Personal Profile;Berg-Brousseau, Henry (d 2022);Berg, Karen (1961- );Human Rights Campaign;Kentucky
results.title: Kentucky Lawmaker Speaks Out About Transgender Son’s Suicide
results.abstract: Henry Berg-Brousseau, who had supported transgender rights since he was in high school, died by suicide at 24. “This hate building across the country weighed on him,” his mother said.

media.caption: Henry Berg-Brousseau at a gala for the Human Rights Campaign, where he was the deputy press secretary for politics.

results.abstract: Want to transfer money from a 529 plan to a Roth I.R.A. or get an after-tax employee match in your Roth 401(k)? You may be in luck.

results.title: Is It Time for a ‘White Lotus’ Vacation?

results.title: In Buffalo, Even the Rescuers Needed Rescuing

results.title: Don Christopher, Who Turned Lowly Garlic Into a Staple, Dies at 88
results.abstract: Known as the Garlic King, he used his enthusiasm and a business acumen to build an empire around the once-lowly “stinking rose.”

media.caption: Don Christopher of the Christopher Ranch in an undated photo. It’s unclear who first called him the Garlic King, but the nickname fit.

results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;Firearms;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Espionage and Intelligence Services;Putin, Vladimir V;Kherson (Ukraine)
results.title: How Citizen Spies Foiled Putin’s Grand Plan for One Ukrainian City
results.abstract: A partisan cell in Kherson spied on, undermined and even hunted down Russian soldiers. Now that Vladimir V. Putin’s forces are gone, people feel free to talk — and to brag a little.

media.caption: Oksana and Dmytro Yevminov aboard their yacht in Kherson, southern Ukraine, last month. They hid guns and sacks of grenades for resistance fighters during the Russian occupation of the city.
media.copyright: Finbarr O’Reilly for The New York Times
